content: Which famous composer wrote the opera "The Marriage of Figaro" and the symphony "Jupiter"?

The famous composer who wrote both "The Marriage of Figaro" and the symphony known as "Jupiter" is Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. "The Marriage of Figaro," or "Le nozze di Figaro," is one of his most celebrated operas, while his Symphony No. 41 in C major, K. 551, is commonly referred to as the "Jupiter" Symphony due to its complexity and grandeur.
